title: 波蘭朋友: What I love in Hong Kong?

replies.msg:
[My public letter to Hongkongers, someone asked on Reddit what I love about HK:]
I'm not hongkonger, but sometimes you need outside perspective to appreciate what you had and have.

What I love in Hong Kong?
I love its freedoms, values on which it was built and its history. I love that it was the most economically free society in modern times (number #1 in economic freedom from 1995 when ranking starts to 2019), that it was build by immigrants from nothing to most developed and richest city in the world. I love that it's a city-state, how civilized it is, that is a monument of humanity's potential, that it became trading hub for global capitalism, that firms (and specialists) from all over the world migrated there, that it has highest IQ population and one of the lowest crime rate, that it maintained its XIX-century freedoms when West lost them, that libertarians from all over the world was always using this city as their guiding star, ideal to strive for, an example to follow, how Milton Friedman flew there to show Americans how free-market looks like, how this city was showing what humanity is capable of when left relatively free to pursue happiness and build prosperity. I love how it accomplished american ideals better than US. I love how lively and changing it was, how it was a mix of what best western and eastern worlds had to offer. How people from all nations, races, religions and cultures could live there their "Hong Kong dream", how they could live there more freely than anywhere else on Earth...

But this is not what I love in Hong Kong the most. The most I love its people, how they care about freedom, how they're the last society on Earth in which you can see this individualistic spirit, this passion for liberty, which you cannot experience that strongly anywhere else, how Hongkongers are culturally mixed of West and East, how they are civilized, cosmopolitan, based, open-minded, rational, kind to each other and to those who share their values, how much unity you can feel and observe in them, true unity built and shared on true values and voluntary cooperation, something which cannot be faked or artificially created by the coercion of the state, how many and how much Hongkongers are authentic, that in their eyes you can see and from their beings you can feel that they have souls, that they are real people, and not dead-zombies like most of humanity, that you can enter into true relations with them and have interactions as with independent human beings and not state-controlled robots. I love how they are independent minded and self-reliant, how they organize voluntarily and bottom-up when needed, how they're not "waiting for government to do sth" like other societies, but just build, create, organize and do themselves, like Americans in XIX-century. I love how their men are masculine, brave and not domesticated slaves, and how their women are feminine, kind and lovely, which we've lost in the West. And the most important thing - I love how they Care, with capital C, for freedom, for betterment of their lives, for their society, for their city, for their values, for their loved ones, for everything, how good-hearted they are...

I love how this country and its society is the best that humanity accomplished and has to offer.

I'm really, really proud of you. What you built, what you made of yourselves. Earth is too much of satanic prison for beautiful souls like yours, but you don't complain or surrender, you just fight against huge evil empire for us all, you just strive against the hardships, against the world and inspire people of good-will on this planet.

This is what I love about Hong Kong and Hongkongers. (And yes, I was crying writing this.)

quote.msg: 叫佢分享多啲波蘭人點戰勝波共

replies.msg:
1981年12月13日早上6時，波共政府頒布軍法並實施戒嚴，以打壓當時如火如荼的「團結運動」。

強大的國家機器卻也未能令波蘭人噤聲。習慣了抵抗的波蘭人發展出不同的「創意」方法來示威：

1. 佩戴「電阻器」。電阻器英文為 "resistor"，與 抵抗者 "resister" 同音，原因不言而喻。

2. 集體佩戴反動佩飾，但當警察到來時卻全部收起並裝作無事發生。

3. 學生放小息時會集體於走廊上靜坐。

4. 在親共藝人演出時不停歡呼拍掌給予支持，令演出無法繼續。

5. 在播放親共影片/聲帶時以嘲弄聲蓋過聲帶。

6. 集體杯葛新聞。於每晚7時半新聞聯播的時候，所有市民以健康為由集體上街散步，並將電視放置於窗前、螢幕向外。

最重要是，保存性命、心存希望。引用波蘭人的一句說話：「冬天是你們的；但春天卻是我們的。」(''The winter is yours but the spring will be ours'')
